description.narrative: Expected development impact through: (i) providing access to private equity capital to SME and mid-cap companies in SEE, ex-Yugoslavia and CEE regions; and (ii) increased investee growth, through the Managers control-oriented strategy focused on improving operational efficiency and corporate governance.

IFC proposes an equity investment of up to 20 million into Evolving Europe Principal Investments I SCSp. (the Fund), managed by Integral Venture Partners Sarl (the Manager). The Fund is targeting to raise 150 million to invest in control-oriented growth equity transactions, or in select cases, minority (or preferred) equity investments with control provisions in small and medium-sized companies (SME) and mid-caps in South Eastern Europe (SEE) in Bulgaria and Romania, in Former Yugoslavia in the countries of Croatia, Kosovo, Montenegro, Serbia, Slovenia, Bosnia & Herzegovina, and North Macedonia as well as in Albania, and in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE) in Hungary, Slovakia and the Czech Republic. The Fund will focus on sectors such as consumer goods and services, healthcare, industrials and TMT. Target ticket size for the Fund is 5-25 million to be invested in 10-12 companies. A delegated authority co-investment envelope for the same amount (up to 20 million) in potential co-investments in the Funds portfolio companies is also being proposed alongside the fund commitment.

participating-org.narrative: EVOLVING EUROPE PRINCIPAL INVESTMENTS FUND I

mailing-address.narrative: Integral Venture Partners Sarl Stefan Tzvetkov Partner stzvetkov@integralvp.com 192 Sloane Street, London SW1X 9QX, United Kingdom www.integralvp.com

name.narrative: It is expected that 40% of Funds investments will be in companies operating in SEE, 40% in former Yugoslavia and 20% in CEE.
